case_title: Usman Limited vs The Collector Of Customs (Appraisement), Quetta And Another
respondent: The Collector Of Customs (Appraisement), Quetta And Another

facts.petitioners: Public Companies incorporated under the Companies Ordinance, 1984
facts.industry_type: Textile industry for manufacturing cotton/blended yarn and allied products
facts.exemption_claimed: Customs duty and sales tax exemption under Notification No. SRO-500(I)/84 and SRO-480(I)/88
facts.dispute: Demand for 'surcharge' under Finance Ordinance, 1982 and 'Iqra surcharge' under Finance Act, 1985

points_raised: Legislation for 'surcharge' and 'Iqra surcharge' exceeds Federal Legislature's powers under Article 70(4) of the Constitution.
Finance Ordinance, 1982 and Finance Act, 1985 lack provisions for collection and recovery machinery.
'Iqra surcharge' for education is outside Federal Legislature's competence.
Finance Ordinance, 1982 lapsed under Article 89(2) of the Constitution.
Surcharges are independent customs duties within Federal Government's competence.
Exemption notifications do not apply to surcharges.
Finance Ordinance, 1982 and Finance Act, 1985 are valid under Articles 141, 142, and 143 of the Constitution.
Finance Ordinance, 1982 was protected under Laws (Continuance in Force) Order, 1977 and Article 270-A of the Constitution.
case_references: Muhammad Steamship Co. Ltd. v. The Commissioner of Income-tax (Central) Karachi PLD 1966 SC 828
Rehmatullah & Sons v. Commissioner Income-tax 1974 SCMR 127
State v. Syed Mir Ahmed Shah PLD 1970 Quetta 49

key_findings.surcharge_character: Additional customs duty sanctioned by Federal Legislative List Part-1.
key_findings.legislation_validity: Finance Ordinance, 1982 and Finance Act, 1985 are valid and protected under Article 270-A.
key_findings.exemption_inapplicability: Exemption notifications under Customs Act do not apply to surcharges.
key_findings.constitutional_procedure: Finance Ordinance, 1982 was not subject to Article 89 procedures.

reasoning: Impugned legislations are within legislative competence.
Surcharges are valid additional customs duties.
Finance Ordinance, 1982 was protected and validated under Article 270-A.
judgment.costs: No costs imposed due to important constitutional points raised.
